titleStmt.title: The Late dreadful and most admired calamity of a parcel of land and many great oaks, and other trees sunk many yards under ground into so deep a water that the tops of the highest oaks are not to be seen, together with a great quantity of land and other trees that are daily falling ... neer unto the parish of Bulkley, about nine miles from Chester, it being part of the land of the Lord Cholmley : this strange accident hapned on the 8 day of Iuly 1657.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Tho. Vere and William Gilbertson ...

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: tightly bound, with loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
